comments.body: Is there a `SocketOption` you can use that can be asserted downstream?

I'm struggling with this one: I can't see a way to hook into the underlying implementation to confirm options have been called on the socket. I checked the akka docs/tests hoping for inspiration but came up short.

I did some reading on Java [UDP broadcast](https://support.biamp.com/Audia-Nexia/Control/TCP_and_UDP_discovery_methods) and modified your test to send UDP messages to a broadcast address instead of a specific hostname/ip. I [stole some code from here](https://www.baeldung.com/java-broadcast-multicast) to get the first broadcast address. If the broadcast socket option is not enabled then no messages are received, so I think this might be a valid test, can you confirm?
I put up a PR on your PR branch: https://github.com/CptLemming/alpakka/pull/1
Sorry for the delay; I did some testing with the code you put up and did confirm without the socket options the tests failed so it seemed a valid way to check this. Thanks!
